caption: The owner is disgusting, he asked me inapropiate questions through google translate (since he doesn't speak any english). After that I asked for a refund and he didn‚Äôt want to give me the money back, Really sad experience for a great singer. Edit: Maps removed my review for offensive language, so im publishing it again (this happened on february 2024). If you are alone and you are young, please take care of yourself.

It was a fun adventure to find the place and to get in there (I had to ask a stranger on the street to call for me and make an appointment because the owner speaks only French). Entrance 10EUR, he asks to wear a mask. I guess it would be more interesting if I could talk to this person - maybe I would get some explanations:) The collection is nice and cute but no evidence that Edith Piaf really lived in this apartment. I would give more stars but I think it is not fair that only half of the apartment can be visited (and it is a very small part) and visitors are not allowed to use the toilet ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Have you ever thought about the terrible state of Edith Piaf's estate? Does she deserve this "museum" only? Full of fake items!!! It is falsely claimed that Piaf lived in this apartment - nonsense. It is unbelievable that the media does not notice all these... but I am glad to see that most of the reviewers are not blind!

Just 2 tiny rooms in a flat with a few posters and stuffs. The entry costs 10 euros per person without any receipt (only cash payment). No photos allowed. If you're a real fan, please don't waste your money there. √âdith would be disappointed.

Completely not worth visiting. On the site it is written that it's free, but the guy wants 5‚Ç¨ per person. The "museum" is just two rooms filled with Edith Piaf stuff. The guy doesn't or barely speaks English, so if you don't speak French don't even bother to interact with him. Visit there takes literally 5 minutes. The only way to book the tickets is to call the guy on the phone, wish you luck when you're a non speaking French foreigner with a foreign number. What's more, the guy requires wearing a mask, although there are almost no mask restrictions in the country, so throughout the "sightseeing" you suffocate yourself, because it's awfully stuffy there. You cannot even take a single photo and when asked about it he responded in super rude way that "it's not a museum". Completely not worth going!!!

What a charming experience! Hours open are limited so make a reservation in advance. It‚Äôs a must-visit petite mus√©e. The historian‚Äôs archive is remarkable. We can‚Äôt wait to go again. For those reviewers grumbling about English, we know these types, there are translation apps online that could serve your language preference. So get over it.

This is a beautiful museum for a true fan of Edith Piaf. I appreciate the man running it for sharing his collection with us, and learning about their unlikely friendship. I really don‚Äôt understand any bad reviews, as this is such a unique little treasure to be able to see these relics, not behind glass, and look through windows that she looked through herself. I had no issue compensating him through purchase of a keychain and postcards with photos of the museum.

The entrance fee is five euro, despite they say free-entrance. Small room filled with handwritten letters, own clothes and porcelan plates on the wall. Unorganised, no explanation. The entrance is possible if you speak French. Big disappointment!
Went there locked door u need to phone a number and make an appointment
You need to book an appointment for the place. For tourists: The man whos in charge of the place is very kind but he does not speak English, only French
I went there but the guy said it‚Äôs closed and he couldn‚Äôt speak English at all. Anyway it was interesting from outside;)
Booking is awkward but understandable. You need to ring the number to make a booking only.
Personal, interesting and made by fans for the fans. Lacking a contextualization of Piaf for a broader audience.
They dont know english and the museum is closed at 15.37
Don't. Just watch a few YouTube's.......
Required prior agreement.Didn¬¥t succeed :)

A wonderful place for a fan of the Paris sparrow. Bernard, very kind, explained everything to us in French but we used the translator. That museum is a gem in Paris and although you have to reserve in advance, both Mr. Ludo, by message, and Bernard when he arrived (and he attended to us) were friendly. Personally, they fulfilled a great dream for me: to see the clothes and personal belongings of dear Edith. I 100% recommend for anyone who loves Piaf to go to the museum in his honor.

We were welcomed very warmly at the Edith Piaf museum and had the pleasure of meeting an enthusiast, a guarantor of her memory. Being in a place so strong with his presence was a great moment. The museum is located in an apartment in which Edith lived, the space is certainly not very large but if you pay attention to everything that is there there is enough to immerse you in the world of Edith had a good time and our host was very attentive to our questions, it's nice to be able to talk with someone so passionate and knowledgeable. THANKS!!

A fan who has his collection of posters, reproductions? an association, without an authentic panel, without a receipt? Payment only in cash. With objects from the Piaf years but nothing that proves their authenticity. No biography or history of the star. FRANKLY IT'S A SCAM! NO OFFICIAL DOCUMENTS NOTHING Useless Go on your way! RUN AWAY!

It was a great idea to get in, we didn't understand where to go, we called the cell phone that is online but there was no line, if you are a foreigner and you don't have a Paris sim that option is even less viable...thanks to the fact that we found a neighbor who helped us and he let us enter the building and by dialing the apartment of the man who lives in the "museum" we were able to enter. Once inside, the don charges ‚Ç¨5 and does NOT let you record or photos, he only speaks French and is kind of grumpy...but it is worth trying and achieving it because the Edith Piaf things that are there transport you to those times, there are dresses ,photos, paintings, records, some of Marcel's boxing gloves, you feel that connection with her. I wish they would make this museum in another place with easy access to the entire public.

Really not recommended! As fascinating as an Edith Piaf fan might find it to see some of her belongings, 10 euros each to enter two small rooms isn't really worth it. Two of us entered, so 20 euros, without even a receipt, for a very short visit. If you want to do something nice for Piaf, bring a rose to her grave in P√®re-Lachaise.
You must book to visit it.

The photos on the site absolutely do not correspond to the reality of the ‚Äúmuseum‚Äù. ‚Ç¨10 entry (cash only) for just two small rooms to visit. The rest is private, yet it looked interesting. We encourage you to buy and leave more than the price of entry. Cold reception. The departure was in the same style. We rather had the impression of disturbing this gentleman who had a train to catch. Magnificent ‚ÄúGien‚Äù displayed on the wall and on the dusty shelves. I doubt they were given to him by artists. Very disappointed. I don't recommend.

I believe that you are truly Piaf's biggest fan and that it will be a dear memory for you to have seen some objects that belonged to him, I advise you not to visit this museum, made up of 2 small rooms, traveled in 10 minutes, devoid of information signs. Paying ‚Ç¨10 per person for that is not justified.
very expensive for so little, plus the guide harassed me
We were asked for ‚Ç¨10 per person even though the description of the visit says free participation! So it's expensive for 20 m¬≤ and its 5 minute visit. But nice things to see

Unfortunately you find yourself in front of a locked door. An answering machine answers the phone - unfortunately the museum is closed. According to the internet it should be open. Pointless! Thank you for making the journey for free.
the welcome really needs to be reviewed, the gentleman is really not friendly! 10‚Ç¨ entry per person is not justified! Damage !

If you're a fan, you'll get your money's worth, pictures, letters, clothes, handbag from Mme Piaf, boxing gloves from Marcel. The nice older gentleman is happy to provide information in French. For those who don't speak French, there is a detailed English explanation to read. You have to register by phone, you will then receive the access codes and will be asked to pay 5 euros (unfortunately some sites still say gratis/free...) What irritated me personally is that some (very old) books, records, the 'original' Piaf perfume, ballpoint pens, t-shirts... are sold at horrendous prices (I wonder if this is all legal? ) And you can only see 2 small rooms in which Mme Piaf only lived for 1 year at the age of 18.  Overall, only for real fans, preferably French speakers

We experienced a timeless moment. The small apartment is filled with items that belonged to Edith, including dresses. There are also many letters written by him, gold records and many other things. The gentleman who visited us knew Edith during the last years of her life, it is fascinating and moving.

Sir not at all pleasant. At the end of the "tour", we are asked (an obligation, not a kind suggestion) to pay a donation/tip. Unfortunately we had very little change (of which we gave it all) and it was supposed to be a free museum. We were reprimanded like never before, plunging us into horrible discomfort. According to this friendly man, we are like wanderers, without money. We just wanted to leave. Otherwise there are some dresses that belonged to Edith Piaf, letters, Marcel Cerdan's gloves...

A moment out of time, as fans of Edith Piaf we really felt privileged. A gentleman with a very pleasant welcome who will happily share his passion for the Piaf girl, as long as you are respectful of his work for this beautiful museum. So don't trust the bad reviews!
A place classified as a museum, but it is an apartment, with two very small rooms. Admission costs 10 euros, very expensive for what it offers. Taking photos is prohibited.

It is a clandestine souvenir shop of the artist. I explain: both on Google Maps and on the Paris Info website it says that it is free but the man who gives the tour gets angry if you don't buy something with money in kind or leave a tip. I did not have money in kind (I am a tourist and the exchange rate is cheaper if I use electronic money). The man fired me for not buying anything even though I told him that I did want to buy something paying with a bank card (I didn't expect the museum to be his old house run by a fan). Even so, it is worth visiting because they have personal objects and the best: letters written in √âdith's handwriting to her lovers and vice versa. If you still want to go, bring a lot of patience and cash and take into account that it is not a museum but rather access to two pieces from his small former apartment.

a very unpleasant welcome, a free museum where you are asked to pay at the end of the visit, for a dusty "museum" of 30 m¬≤ where you are shown two dresses, a stuffed toy by Edith Piaf and a whole range of items for sale (usb keys, book, cd, cup, etc...) the purpose of this museum is for commercial purposes, nothing more. Having passed my last coin to a homeless person (everyone knows Paris and its poverty) I was not able to deposit change in the dome of the Edith Piaf friends association. The museum host was quite unpleasant and slammed the door in our faces at the end of the visit after forcing our hand to pay for a museum which basically claimed to be free. I strongly advise against this museum which is very disappointing and risks disappointing many fans.

25 m2 apartment not showing the life of Edith Piaf knowing that she only lived one year. That is to say at the age of 18 very few objects belonging to him a lot of earthenware on the wall very disappointed with this visit Not recommended for oppressed people given the narrowness of the places, very full of carpets and heterogeneous objects as well as the crowds Very disappointed with this visit
Very nice museum

There are only two rooms but they have your clothes, shoes, gold and platinum records, even your stuffed animals. The person who answers only speaks French and that day he was not in a very good mood. But without a doubt every Edith fan should know him. You cannot forget to call to make an appointment, it is not open to the public and it is in an ordinary building in the city.
